results.title: U.S. Soldier Tests Positive for Virus in South Korea
results.abstract: The soldier, the first U.S. service member known to be infected, has been quarantined in his off-base residence, the military said.

media.caption: The entrance to Camp Walker, a U.S. Army base in Daegu, South Korea, on Thursday. A U.S. soldier found to be infected with the coronavirus had visited the base on Monday.

results.title: Ben Affleck Tried to Drink Away the Pain. Now He’s Trying Honesty.
results.abstract: The actor speaks frankly about everything from his addictive behavior and his divorce to why he lied about that back tattoo.

results.title: Outbreak in Northern Italy Poses National Challenge
results.abstract: China appears to be getting the disease under control, but rapidly expanding outbreaks in Iran, South Korea and Italy are raising fears of a broader epidemic. Milan, usually buzzing with activity, is eerily quiet.

media.caption: The University of Milan, one of Europe’s largest universities, closed on Monday due to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus in Italy.
